description.narrative:
Assessment of Project Outcomes: - Economy-wide effects: The Project is expected to contribute to economic activity, direct job creation, and preservation of the existing high-quality jobs (1,000 employees) and the broader social fabric that the operations of the Company and the salaries contribute to. The Project also indirectly supports jobs and economic activity for local businesses that engage in the distribution of final products and sourcing of raw materials. - Stakeholders: Consumers in Kenya, Uganda and Malawi will benefit from improved affordability and access to a high-quality variety of bedding products. The Project will achieve this through (i) debt refinancing and expansion of raw materials storage capacity which will lower procurement cost of raw materials as a result of better working capital management, translating into improved affordability of final products sold; (ii) increased assistance to SMEs distributors through access to trade credits, which will intensify linkages in the value chain; and (iii) expansion in the number of retail distributors across the target countries as the Company grows its production.
Assessment of Contribution to Market Creation: - Competitiveness: IFC anticipates that the investment will promote sector competitiveness in Malawi via the adoption of innovative manufacturing processes. Through the Project, MFA will expand its production capacity in Malawi, adopt novel technology and machinery, increasing its overall efficiency. Market impact in Kenya and Uganda is expected to be limited.

IFC is invited to provide a US$7.5 million A loan and US$7.5m in B/parallel loans to Mammoth Foam Africa (MFA or the Company), a leading producer of polyurethane foam mattresses, spring mattresses and related foam and bedding products, operating through three subsidiaries in Kenya (Super Foam), Uganda (Euroflex) and Malawi (Vitafoam), to create a single consolidated group long-term loan, and to improve efficiency, expand production, and build storage capacity, among other capex investments.
